source_books: Science and Practice of Strength Training
training_philosophy: Systematic periodization, evidence-based methods, and elite performance optimization
evidence_base: Olympic champion training protocols and elite sports science

exercises.scientific_explanation: Snatch grip deadlifts develop the wide-grip pulling strength essential for Olympic lifting while improving upper back and trap development. Research with Olympic lifters shows this exercise creates 15% greater trap activation than conventional deadlifts while building the specific strength needed for snatch receives.
research_citations: Joyce & Lewindon (2014): Olympic lifting assistance work
Stone et al. (2006): Olympic lifting training
exercises.performance_metrics: Load progression, bar speed, technique maintenance
exercises.form_cue: Wide grip, drive through legs, keep bar close, strong finish
exercises.common_mistake: Grip too wide or allowing bar to drift away from body

exercises.scientific_explanation: Depth jumps exploit the stretch-shortening cycle to develop reactive strength index crucial for jumping and sprinting sports. Verkhoshansky's research with Olympic athletes establishes optimal drop heights of 0.3-0.8m with ground contact times <200ms for maximal training effect.
exercises.performance_metrics: Ground contact time <200ms, jump height, reactive strength index
exercises.form_cue: Step off box, land and explode immediately with minimal ground contact
exercises.common_mistake: Contact times >250ms reduce plyometric effect by 40%

exercises.scientific_explanation: Contrast training pairs heavy strength movements with explosive exercises to optimize power development through post-activation potentiation. Research with elite athletes shows 8-12% improvements in power output when heavy squats are paired with jump training within 3-8 minutes.
research_citations: Comfort et al. (2018): Complex training review
exercises.performance_metrics: Power output improvement, velocity maintenance, technique quality
exercises.form_cue: Execute heavy lift with maximum intent, then explosive movement immediately
exercises.common_mistake: Inadequate rest between exercises or too much fatigue from heavy lift

exercises.scientific_explanation: Altitude mask training creates respiratory stress to improve oxygen utilization efficiency and mental toughness under stress. Research shows improvements in lactate tolerance and breathing efficiency, though altitude effects are limited compared to true altitude training.
research_citations: Porcari et al. (2016): Altitude mask training effects
Granados et al. (2016): Respiratory training research
exercises.performance_metrics: Breathing rate, oxygen saturation, exercise tolerance
exercises.form_cue: Maintain proper exercise form despite breathing restriction
exercises.common_mistake: Using mask too early in training or with inadequate base fitness

exercises.scientific_explanation: Grappling-specific core training develops the rotational strength and anti-extension stability required for ground fighting and submission defense. Research shows core strength directly correlates with grappling performance and injury prevention.
research_citations: James et al. (2013): MMA physical demands
exercises.performance_metrics: Strength endurance, position maintenance, power output
exercises.form_cue: Maintain control while resisting rotational forces
exercises.common_mistake: Using momentum instead of controlled strength
